alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Western Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CHESTERFIELD...NORTH CENTRAL DINWIDDIE AND SOUTHEASTERN AMELIA COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 640 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Moseley to Sutherland. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Chesterfield Court House around 700 PM EDT. Chester around 705 PM EDT. Bon Air around 710 PM EDT. Bellwood around 715 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Pocahontas State Park, Church Road, Beach, Winterpock, Drewrys Bluff, Centralia, and Chesterfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Western Chesterfield
